formattedAddress: 283 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 283 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA

editorialSummary.text: Cozy Indian restaurant serving family-style dishes, lassis & classic desserts in a relaxed setting.

originalText.text: It’s a cozy restaurant with friendly and attentive staff. We got samosas, garlic naan, mushroom saag and chicken tikka masala. The portions were generous and it was all very tasty. The saag was a bit spicy for my husband so he asked for some yogurt to cool the spice. They charged us $6 extra for that. It was a necessary for him so for us it was worth the charge.

text.text: It’s a cozy restaurant with friendly and attentive staff. We got samosas, garlic naan, mushroom saag and chicken tikka masala. The portions were generous and it was all very tasty. The saag was a bit spicy for my husband so he asked for some yogurt to cool the spice. They charged us $6 extra for that. It was a necessary for him so for us it was worth the charge.

originalText.text:
Atmosphere (3/5): Right when you walk in, you are welcomed with the aroma of spices is intoxicating. You walk into a tight homey dining space that fits 10 people, connected right to the kitchen. There’s some half-outdoor dining available and then a second floor that overlooks the lower floor. The second floor can accommodate upwards of 15 people and the bathroom.
Service (5/5): While the staff did not speak English very well, they were extremely welcoming and took the time to get to know me! They served everyone with a warmth and professionalism. I felt like I was a guest in their home.
Food: The food was FIRE—there was such depth to the flavors
Vegetable Samsoa (4/5): The samosa complemented well with the various dips! I felt like the inside could have been a
Garlic Naan (4/5): I would definitely recommend getting 1 order per person as they were not terribly big but very nicely seasoned and soft. I wish they were saltier or had a bit more garlic flavor.
Kashmiri Roganjosh (5/5): The lamb chunks were very tender. The curry was seasoned with a punch of flavors and just slightly spicy. I loved every bite.
I commend the staff who have to run up and down with our orders!! Overall, very pleasant and delicious meal (and leftovers!)

originalText.text:
Highlights: Generous portions, rich flavors, juicy meats, extensive menu

Came here with 3 friends. We shared all our choices. The sweet naan was delicious. All the entrees were perfectly done. Not the spiciest Indian food I have had, but the flavors were still vibrant. Curries come with rice. The light beer offerings they have are solid. Fast and friendly service. An area for improvement would be some background music while we dined. We shared 4 apps and 4 mains + drinks for a price point around 30-40 dollars per person including tip. I would bring friends back to this business.

originalText.text: My experience here was a 10/10. I have visited this place with my friends 3 times and all times have been great with no complaints. I ordered the Malai Chicken Kabab and ate it with white rice. My friends both got an order of Chicken Tikka Masala and we shared 2 orders of the Garlic Naan. The food was fresh and was ready quick, we only waited a few minutes after ordering. The staff was very attentive and welcoming. The food was delicious and the portions were great for the price. I look forward to going back with my friends and I recommend this for anyone looking to eat amazing Indian food.

I look forward to going back with my friends and I recommend this for anyone looking to eat amazing Indian food.

originalText.text:
Some of our dishes were a bit bland, while one was very tasty.  We wonder whether they made mild rather than our desired medium spice.  That could have been the problem.

Server was very good!  Atmosphere - cute and cozy place, but the heating unit upstairs was a bit loud when it was on (on & off).
